Bio.description: Available from October 2025, I am seeking a full-time position in Deep Learning, preferably Computer Vision. With a strong background in these fields, I aim to develop practical solutions and contribute to innovative projects in a collaborative environment.
Bio.name: Vojtěch Sýkora

education.desc:
• Full scholarship from the DAAD German Academic Exchange Service for whole study program of 2 years.
• Focused on Deep Learning, Computer Vision, and Reinforcement Learning.
• Thesis: Multi-modal Deep Learning for Automated Schematic Analysis

• Computer Science studies with a focus on Artificial Intelligence. 
• Thesis focused on Proximal Policy Optimization for Car Racing with unpredictable Wind.
An interdisciplinary AI curriculum bringing together students, teachers, and researchers from prestigious Prague universities.
education.school: prg.ai & Charles University & CTU in Prague

education.desc:
• Higher Level - Mathematics, Physics, Economics
• Standard Level - English, Czech, and German languages
• Extended Essay - Mathematics (Quaternions)

experiences.company: FZI Research Center for Information Technology
experiences.desc:
• Independently create a comprehensive dataset of Raspberry Pi schematics for computer vision analysis.
• Refine a multi-modal pipeline to extract semantics from schematics, benchmarking it against state-of-the-art Visual Language Models (VLMs).
• Engineer end-to-end components including object detection, instance segmentation, rotation recognition, text recognition, and edge detection to improve information extraction and data quality.

• Lead the development of an agentic LLM prototype for advanced data processing.
• Adapt and optimize an existing multi-modal pipeline to extract semantics and graph structure from switchboard schematics.
• Identify and classify visual components in complex electrical diagrams to support downstream automation for enterprise clients (market cap up to €180B).
• Implement targeted refinements to improve pipeline robustness and accuracy.

experiences.company: Czech Institute of Informatics, Robotics and Cybernetics
experiences.desc:
• Conducted research on identifying the most congested areas in urban environments, specifically in Dublin and Luxembourg.
• Adapted gravitational clustering techniques to detect high-traffic regions, optimizing urban mobility analysis.
• Contributed to a larger framework integrating centralized traffic routing into the SUMO traffic simulation environment. 
• Worked with publicly available traffic datasets, applying data-driven approaches to identify problematic traffic zones.
• Collaborated with a research team working on path optimization and route generation within congested areas.
• Co-authored a research paper submitted to Expert Systems with Applications (ESWA), Elsevier, titled: 'A Framework for Evaluating and Analysing Centralised Urban Traffic Routing Techniques.'
• More under project: Urban Traffic Control Framework

• Project 1 (2020): Analyzed 600K+ records in MySQL using Python-based algorithms to compare and extract key insights.
• Project 2 (2022): Developed an animated choropleth map for visualizing demographic shifts (Python, GeoJSON, NumPy, Pandas, Plotly).

experiences.company: US Air Force Research Lab & CTU FEE AI Center
experiences.desc:
• Contributed to the FRAS (Flexible and Resilient Autonomous Systems) research project, funded by the US Air Force Research Lab in cooperation with Carnegie Mellon University and CTU FEE AI Center, focusing on adversarial environments. 
• Developed a Python and PDDL-based environment generator to train single and multi-agent AI planning strategies.
• Applied classical planning and game theory concepts to create robust algorithms for harsh weather and potential hostile attacks.
• Designed and developed an Android app to manage multiple Bluetooth Low Energy devices at once using Kotlin.

• Officiated over 100 games in various age categories, including U14, U16, U18, and adults.
• Developed leadership, teamwork, and decision-making skills in high-pressure situations.

experiences.company: Czech Institute of Informatics, Robotics and Cybernetics
experiences.desc:
• Automated 3D printing tasks for ABB YUMI robot at CIIRC.
• Developed a scannable coding system to sort printed parts.

• Developed a startup connecting visually impaired people with visually healthy people.
• Won Brussels Demo Day, and got invited to MIT (Boston, USA) for further development.
experiences.role: Winner of a MIT Startup Competition

projects.description:
• Developed a transformer-based pipeline leveraging SVT and Video Mamba models on the complex Charades dataset.
• For Classification, engineered a custom data processing pipeline with sliding window inference, achieving up to 29.82 mAP while reducing dependence on extensive labeled data.
• For Captioning, integrated a GPT-2 based decoder to generate detailed descriptions, achieving BLEU-1 scores above 0.22, demonstrating effective utilization of spatiotemporal features for coherent caption generation.
projects.title: Video Transformers for Classification and Captioning

projects.description:
• This project leverages Detectron2, a transformer-based detection model, for accurate 2D instance segmentation using data with bounding boxes and masks.
• Using a pre-trained Mask R-CNN architecture, it effectively identifies and segments diverse objects, demonstrating high accuracy even on challenging datasets.
• The approach achieved a strong overall Average Precision (AP) of 46.1, highlighting its effectiveness for detailed image analysis tasks.
projects.title: Instance Segmentation Challenge

projects.description:
• Implemented Proximal Policy Optimization (PPO) algorithm for training reinforcement learning agents in the OpenAI CarRacing environment with custom Wind.
• Developed robust training strategies, optimized hyperparameters, and thoroughly evaluated agent performance, culminating in a comprehensive thesis and analysis of PPO effectiveness in autonomous driving tasks.
• Consistently reached score of 900+ beating the environment.
projects.title: Proximal Policy Optimization for Car Racing

projects.description:
• Conducted a comprehensive analysis of ischemic heart disease (IHD) in Germany, identifying its prominence among cardiovascular diseases and its significant contribution to the national death rate.
• Applied statistical analysis and Random Forest regression modeling to assess the influence of healthcare spending, alcohol consumption, fat consumption, and demographic factors like median age.
• The project revealed that alcohol consumption, median age, and healthcare expenditures significantly affect the death rate of IHD, while the influence of fat consumption remained inconclusive. The analysis provided insights into Germany's lifestyle factors and healthcare efficiency, suggesting avenues for public health improvements.
projects.title: Ischemic Heart Disease Analysis in Germany

projects.description:
• Conducted research on identifying the most congested areas in urban environments, specifically in Dublin and Luxembourg.
• Developed and adapted gravitational clustering techniques to detect high-traffic regions, optimizing urban mobility analysis.
• Contributed to a larger framework integrating centralized traffic routing into the SUMO traffic simulation environment. 
• Worked with publicly available traffic datasets, applying data-driven approaches to identify problematic traffic zones.
• Collaborated with a research team working on path optimization and route generation within congested areas.
• Co-authored a research paper submitted to Expert Systems with Applications (ESWA), Elsevier, titled: 'A Framework for Evaluating and Analysing Centralised Urban Traffic Routing Techniques.'
projects.title: Urban Traffic Control Framework

projects.description:
• This project visualizes population movement and demographic trends using interactive maps created with GeoPandas, Numpy, and Plotly.
• It provides dynamic, data-driven insights into population patterns across regions over time, leveraging geospatial analysis to clearly represent complex demographic shifts.
projects.title: GeoJson Map Animation

projects.description:
• This project analyzed a large dataset of 180,000+ recipes from Food.com to visualize ingredient trends, nutritional content, and cuisine popularity across global regions.
• Using using advanced JavaScript libraries (D3.js), the analysis explored ingredient similarities, dietary patterns, and popularity dynamics, offering interactive filters for detailed cuisine comparisons.
projects.title: BioVis Food Data Visualization

projects.description:
• My personal dynamic portfolio website. Built with ReactJS, Tailwind CSS, and Firebase for backend integration.
• It is optimized for a seamless experience across both desktop and mobile devices.
projects.title: Portfolio Website
